block.p: Alexandra Dickinson Kean, the daughter of Thomas H. Kean, the former governor of New Jersey, and Deborah B. Kean of Far Hills, N.J., was married yesterday to Benjamin Brewster Strong, a son of Ann S. Strong of Setauket, N.Y., and the late Raymond B. Strong Jr. The Rev. Ralph Merrill performed the ceremony at St. John's Episcopal Church in Fishers Island, N.Y.
The bride and bridegroom graduated from Colby College, where they met.

Alexandra Dickinson Kean, the daughter of Thomas H. Kean, the former governor of New Jersey, and Deborah B. Kean of Far Hills, N.J., was married yesterday to Benjamin Brewster Strong, a son of Ann S. Strong of Setauket, N.Y., and the late Raymond B. Strong Jr. The Rev. Ralph Merrill performed the ceremony at St. John's Episcopal Church in Fishers Island, N.Y.
The bride and bridegroom graduated from Colby College, where they met.

Ms. Strong, 25, teaches history at Needham High School in Needham, Mass. She has a master's degree in family, culture and society from Wheelock College and a master's in teaching from Simmons College.

The bride's father, who was governor from 1982 to 1990, is the president of Drew University in Madison, N.J. The bride's grandfather Robert Winthrop Kean was a member of the House of Representatives from 1938 to 1958. Her great-grandfather Hamilton Fish Kean was a senator from New Jersey.

Mr. Strong, 28, is a senior project manager at Vertex Engineering Services, environmental consultants, in Weymouth, Mass. He received a master's degree in marine environmental science from the State University at Stony Brook, N.Y. His mother is an agent for Virginia A. O'Dwyer Real Estate in Stony Brook. His father was a vice president for commercial lending in Melville, N.Y., for Chemical Bank.
